Goodbye, Rep. Steve King. You are certainly not the only white supremacist in federal government, but you were among the most prominent.

It’s a shame Republicans held you up as long as they did.

SEE YA 👋🏽 https://twitter.com/redistrict/status/1268013341773041667 QT @Redistrict I've seen enough. Rep. Steve King (R) has been defeated in #IA04.

RT @AdamLaxalt Officers of @LVMPD did not need to die. Property did not need to be vandalized and burned. Governor Sisolak should have called the National Guard day one. Protest should have been confined to daylight hours and early curfews strictly enforced. This needs to happen today. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZhgoMpVAAAmSII.jpg

We stand with Officer Underwood. We are grateful for his service and sacrifice.  God bless his grieving family. https://twitter.com/stephenpuetz/status/1268011733974573058 QT @stephenpuetz Officer Underwood was murdered late Friday night during the Oakland rioting. 

His family’s GoFundMe only has $52k...I know we can do better. 

His sister Angela is a friend, she verified this is the legit account. 

If you can’t give, please RT. Thx.

https://www.gofundme.com/f/support-these-heroes-and-their-families

RT @thehill Sen. @tedcruz: "A lot of these authoritarians on the local level were quick to send in the police to arrest a dad for playing softball with a six-year-old daughter or to try to shut down a church that was daring to worship." http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1267929882891358210/img/uYlxq23ZDID9bTOD.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1267929882891358210/vid/472x270/K_85vTq5hZFyQcCc.mp4?tag=13

Fellow police officers described him as "the type of brother that would've given his life to save them if he had to."

Remember him. https://twitter.com/stillgray/status/1267945466357927936 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZi-iehVAAEBcC5.png

Did his life matter? Or was he not black?

Do the Leftist anarchists celebrates his death?

Hollywood?

And the media ignores. 

“Peaceful protest.”

Fellow police officers described him as "the type of brother that would've given his life to save them if he had to."

Jeremiah 30:17
RT @NTU Congratulations to the 2019 Taxpayers’ Friend Award Winners in the Senate: @SenMikeLee, Senator @RandPaul, @SenatorBraun, @SenTedCruz and @SenToomey!   https://www.ntu.org/ratecongress

Former members of the intelligence community have every right to oppose or support actions taken by President Trump

But its disingenuous of them to portray hyperbolic conclusions such as these as dispassionate intelligence analysis
 https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/cia-veterans-who-monitored-crackdowns-abroad-see-troubling-parallels-in-trump-handling-of-protests/2020/06/02/7ab210b8-a4f6-11ea-bb20-ebf0921f3bbd_story.html

This time we must not fail to admit & confront the lingering cancer of racial inequality. 

Protests demanding this are both a right & a necessity

But there is no right & can be no tolerance for using protests as cover to commit crimes or foment anarchy

America cries out for unification. Yet Trump is ripping it apart by tear-gassing peaceful protestors so he could pose for photos with a bible outside a church.

We need real leadership -- not a President whose message and actions fan the flames of discord, bigotry and violence. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1268168157526720512/pu/img/nFKfRo5hl_rWpkD5.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1268168157526720512/pu/vid/480x270/fBFkj9Y8pRyEvayM.mp4?tag=10

RT @itsgabrielleu #BreonnaTaylor killers are still on the job. Its not enough to fire the chief. Arrest her killers and bring them to justice! https://twitter.com/MinoWarrior/status/1267759549466980353 QT @MinoWarrior A quick reminder the cops who killed #BreonnaTaylor are still on the job just like the one who killed #PamelaTurner last year. Black women have fought against police brutality and anti-black vigilantism for over a century. Who will fight for us? http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZf8ld2XgAEzEuP.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZf8ld4X0AEzc4Q.jpg

The people of Ferguson voted for historic change last night. 

Congratulations, @Ella4Ferguson, on your victory. Your leadership in Ferguson will pave the way for a better future for the next generation. 
https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/03/us/politics/ella-jones-ferguson-mayor.html

I joined @ViolenceNBoston this week for a powerful discussion with community leaders & loved ones of Eric Garner, Andrew Kearse, Stephon Clark, & other Black men & women who died at the hands of police. This is where I’d like to start for real accountability & change: http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1268186769444536321/img/KFG8IOV6AejLWdZV.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1268186769444536321/vid/480x270/q-CIpMRwT7cRI88d.mp4?tag=13

Chairs of 🇦🇺,🇨🇦,🇳🇿, & 🇬🇧 foreign affairs committees call on UN Sec. General @antonioguterres to establish a @UN special envoy for #HongKong.Beijing shouldn't profit from its broken promises in #HongKong, & the UN has a role in monitoring China's breaches of the Joint Declaration. https://twitter.com/TomTugendhat/status/1267925270406868998 QT @TomTugendhat I’ve joined fellow Foreign Affairs Committee chairs from Aus, Can, NZ - Sen David Fawcett, Michael Levitt MP and Simon O’Connor MP in calling on @UN Sec Gen @antonioguterres to send a Special Envoy to protect the rule of law and human rights in Hong Kong. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZiTTtmWkAECbKZ.jpg

Officials at the highest level of the Obama administration weaponized the FBI & DOJ to go after the incoming administration for political gain. Today at @senjudiciary, we’re seeking to uncover the truth about what happened and who was responsible. https://twitter.com/senjudiciary/status/1268182276279582725 QT @senjudiciary Clip from May 2018 referenced by Chairman @LindseyGrahamSC in today’s hearing with Former Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein: http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1268182173171015680/pu/img/TD-jZ_dgaj7T8RGr.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1268182173171015680/pu/vid/476x270/gEMiZKo1n2dfgLi9.mp4?tag=10

Our budget process is broken. Congress needs to work with the Administration to reduce excessive and wasteful spending and implement necessary budget reforms, instead of rubberstamping bloated, 11th hour spending bills. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1268182756242178048/img/HtdgInzTfWnvyVSY.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1268182756242178048/vid/480x270/Bc6wyn-AJ_WNoAvv.mp4?tag=13

Senator Rubio chairs a @SmallBizCmte hearing examining the impacts of the #COVID_19 pandemic on America's #smallbiz economy.

I see a lot of corporations releasing bland statements w a hashtag.

No. This moment calls for transformation.

Your statement should include your org’s INTERNAL commitments to change, particularly if you’ve been called on it before.

Give people change.
https://www.forbes.com/sites/alexreimer/2020/06/03/aoc-exposes-vapid-corporate-support-for-blackouttuesday-by-calling-out-washington-football-team/#1adf92d470c0

I'll bet on the good people of this country over this president any day of the week. The peaceful protesters in the streets right now are showing once again that the power of the people is greater than the people in power. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZmSn14X0AMRsPu.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1268205364903923712/vid/480x270/_a7SdWhmjkKH6HvX.mp4?tag=13

We have got to act boldly to eradicate systemic racism and police violence. I am calling for sweeping policy reforms to protect people—particularly communities of color—who have suffered violence for far too long. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZmPAUSWoAU42Fj.jpg

Lets agree on this,no matter how you define their extremism & warped ideology

Or even if they just see the chance to go wilding

The people using protests to injure or kill police & innocent people,set fires & loot businesses must be stopped immediately. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZmRMgBXsAEy9oC.jpg

Looking forward to joining this critical forum on racial justice with @RepBonnie, @RepDonaldPayne, @SandSJ_NJ, and advocates later today. I encourage folks to sign up to join us at 5pm ET: https://senate.webex.com/senate/onstage/g.php?MTID=e7ace8b2feffe2ce2114569cb8678e4f5 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZmPE7eXsAEPiNb.jpg

As thousands hit the streets in NYC for justice, please make sure that you are caring for yourselves physically, mentally, and emotionally.

If you are regularly out w/ high exposure for ANY reason, please get COVID tested.

Testing is now free for all in NYC. As it should be. https://twitter.com/patkiernan/status/1268192688173649920 QT @patkiernan NYC expands free covid testing program to include any New Yorker who requests a test. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZmGhdtX0AEo_Zt.jpg

Democrats are taking decisive action to address policing and safeguard every American’s right to equal justice. We hope Republicans will join us. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1268215309854486529/pu/img/U6kNe8SIukymDdfU.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1268215309854486529/pu/vid/480x270/OYcgAlynS6Xmd2Jx.mp4?tag=10

RT @MikeLevin The death of George Floyd is tragic, and the loss of another African American life especially so given the corrosive role racism has played in our nation's history. The 14th Amendment calls for equal justice under the law. Black Lives Matter. We must stand for nothing less: (1/8)

The first responsibility of government is to protect the safety of all Americans. Eric Garner and George Floyd should be alive today. It’s appalling that chokeholds are still classified as an acceptable use of force. I support @Hakeem_Jeffries's bill to outlaw them and @SenGillibrand’s Senate introduction of it—this is just a start. https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/congressional-black-caucus-propose-police-reforms-george-floyds/story?id=71023611

Mientras las cirugías electivas en todo el país vuelven a empezar y la #TemporadaDeHuracanes está en curso, la @RedCross se enfrenta a una creciente necesidad de donaciones de sangre.

https://www.redcrossblood.org/espanol/donar-sangre.html http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EWuUr1iXYAAXB3l.jpg
In the days and weeks to come, we will be guided by the experiences & expertise of @RepKarenBass and @TheBlackCaucus as we seek to achieve progress & secure justice for Americans nationwide.

Stopping police violence must be a priority in this country if we are to ever come to terms with America’s history of racial injustice. Congress must address deadly use of force by police and reform policing practices. #BlackLivesMatter

As elective surgeries resume across the country and #hurricaneseason gets underway, @RedCross faces a growing need for blood donations.

Find information on how to donate below ⬇️
https://redcrossblood.org http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EWuUjHWXQAEHvE7.jpg

I share in your sadness, anger, and pain. Our country can no longer accept the status quo where Black people are treated as less than human. We need an America that lives up to the ideals of Equal Justice Under Law.

This is just a start—and I’m in this for the long haul. Congress is responsible for holding this administration accountable—and anyone refusing to condemn their reckless, racist, and authoritarian actions shares responsibility for the consequences.

I’m also introducing an NDAA amendment to create an Office for Civil Rights at the Pentagon to hold the Department of Defense accountable when it violates Americans’ civil rights or discriminates against them based on race, ethnicity, or religion.

I'm supporting Tim Kaine’s NDAA amendment to ban the use of military force against civilians. We've seen too many weapons of war used against peaceful protestors and military forces patrolling our streets. It's morally reprehensible—and should be illegal.
https://www.reuters.com/article/us-minneapolis-police-defense-bill/us-senator-wants-defense-bill-to-ban-use-of-military-against-peaceful-protests-idUSKBN2392VH

I’ve also demanded an investigation into the role Department of Defense officials may have played in the attacks on protesters in Lafayette Square—as well as in protests across the country.

https://thehill.com/homenews/senate/500832-warren-asks-pentagon-ig-to-probe-military-role-in-trumps-protest-response

I’m calling for Barr’s resignation—and for an investigation into any Justice Department officials involved in this gross display of propaganda and the violence that preceded it. 

https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/barr-personally-ordered-removal-of-protesters-near-white-house-leading-to-use-of-force-against-largely-peaceful-crowd/2020/06/02/0ca2417c-a4d5-11ea-b473-04905b1af82b_story.html

Holding this morally bankrupt and relentlessly corrupt administration accountable is a critical job, and Congress needs to step up to the plate now more than ever.
